data.name: Shinsekai
data.desc: An area of mood that can feel the atmosphere of the 1970s and '80s. Cheap restaurants, shops, and more. Shinsekai was established in 1903 to make the exhibition hall of the Osaka Expo, meaning Shinsegae.

data.name: Spa World
data.desc: It is the largest spa theme park in Osaka. There is an exotic hot spring bath, sauna, and relaxation facilities, which is good for relaxing fatigue.
data.way: Take the Midosuji Line Sakaisuji Line and get off at Boots Ene Mae Station.
data.fee: [Less than 3 hours] Weekday ¥ 2,400, under 12 years ¥ 1,300. Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays: ¥ 2,700, ¥ 12,500

data.name: Shitennoji
data.desc: It is the oldest temple in Japan and boasts a history of 1,500 years. But most of the buildings were destroyed in World War II and rebuilt in 1971.
data.way: Get off at Yurigaoka Station on Shitennojima, Tanimachi Line.

data.name: AbenoHarukasu
data.desc: It is the tallest building in Japan of 300m. At the top of the building is the Harukasu 300 Observatory, which can be seen at a glance in Osaka. The 16th floor is the Harukas Museum, and the 2nd to 11th floors are the Kintetsu Department Store.
data.time: [Observation Hall at Harukas 300] 09:00 ~ 22:00. [Abeno Harukas Museum] Mon-Fri: 10:00 ~ 20:00. Saturdays, Sundays and holidays: 10:00 to 18:00. Closed on Mondays.
data.way: Get off at Tennoji Station on the Tanimachi Line Midosuji Line.

data.name: Tsuruhashi
data.desc: It was created in the 1920s as a Korean-American market where the Japanese people living in Taji feel the joy of their Korean descendants. It is famous for the town where you can eat cheap traditional Korean food for locals. Recently, the number of people looking for the Korean Wave boom increased.
data.way: Get off at Tsuruhashi Station on the Sennichimae Line. Or get off at Tsuruhashi Station on the JR Osaka Kanjo Line.

data.name: Janjan Yokocho
data.desc: The merchants were named after their performance of the traditional musical instrument shamisen. Inexpensive township is built in the narrow bamboo grove. It is an old-fashioned street.

data.name: Tsutenkaku
data.desc: A 103m observatory built in 1912. It is the highest in Shinsekai. It was dismantled in World War II for the supply of iron for munitions production. The current tower was rebuilt in 1956. It is said that it was made by imitating the Eiffel Tower.
data.way: Get off at Ebisucho Station on the Sakaisuji Line.
data.fee: ¥ 700. College student ¥ 500. Secondary students ¥ 400. Elementary school students and under ¥ 300.

data.name: Itsinji
data.desc: A temple built in 1596. It is surprising that there is Amitabha Temple, which is made up of the remains of believers for 1 million years.
data.way: Get off at Tennoji Station on the Tanimachi Line or Midosuji Line.

data.name: Hankai tram
data.desc: A one-street streetcar with analog sensibility. It started running in 1902 and has a history of more than 100 years.
data.way: Get off at Ebisucho Station on the Sakaisuji Line.
data.fee: [One ticket] ¥ 200. Elementary school age and under ¥ 100. [One-day pass] ¥ 600. Elementary school students and under ¥ 300.

data.name: Osaka City Museum of Art
data.desc: A museum displaying Japanese national treasures and Asian antiques. 8,000 Japanese and Chinese paintings, sculptures, and works of art are circulated. Special exhibitions will also be held on the website.
data.way: Get off at Tennoji Station on the Tanimachi Line Midosuji Line.
data.fee: ¥ 300. College students, high school students ¥ 200. Free for junior high school students or younger. (Depending on the exhibition)
